image.altText: outside view of federal court in australia

props.synopsis: A group of Canberra's social housing tenants are set to get their day in the Federal Court, with the way cleared for a class action against the ACT government over a plan to move them from their homes.

title.children: ACT social housing tenants' class action gets green light

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Former Canberra Scout and police officer Alexander John Clancy is facing 11 charges against two alleged victims, including rape, committing acts of indecency and using electronic means to deprave a young person.

title.children: Former Canberra Scout faces trial for alleged historic child sex offences

image.altText: Two women stand with an arm around one another, wearing traditional furs.

props.synopsis: The remains of two Moriori ancestors begin their journey home to New Zealand from the National Museum of Australia in Canberra as part a years-long repatriation process.

title.children: Moriori ancestors' remains 'coming home' after years in Canberra museum

image.altText: Head shot of a man with slicked-back blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Kristian White says he is "truly sorry" for tasering aged care resident Clare Nowland in a letter to her family ahead of his sentencing for manslaughter.

title.children: Apology letter reveals ex-cop's regret over tasering 95yo

image.altText: Eastern brown snake beside a stone wall.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of snakes are moved from backyards, inside homes and other urban areas into reserves and bushland around Canberra each year — but until now, little has been known about what happens to snakes after they’re released.

title.children: Snakes become 'very disoriented', lose weight and get sick when relocated

image.altText: A closed sign blocking a four-lane road in a city.

props.synopsis: Businesses on the western side of London Circuit, now off-limits for vehicles between Northbourne and Edinburgh Avenues, face a choice of adapting or closing as light rail construction work sees customers decrease.

title.children: Businesses adapt or shut as light rail construction closes London Circuit

image.altText: Close up of actress Charlize Theron with short blonde hair

props.synopsis: There is an "unprecedented" level of filming activity across the Canberra region at the moment, with Hollywood stars Eric Bana, Charlize Theron and Taron Egerton all in town.

title.children: Charlize Theron in Canberra amid 'unprecedented' level of screen production activity

image.altText: A corpse flower in full bloom.

props.synopsis: The corpse flower at the Australian National Botanic Gardens is at least 15 years old but had never flowered before now.

title.children: 'Smells like dead rat': Corpse flower blooms in Canberra after 15-year wait

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair looks serious.

props.synopsis: Rent crisis among the lowest-income First Nations households as new research drills down on the 'unmet' housing needs.

title.children: The stress of finding an affordable home. What could help First Nations people?

image.altText: A closeup of Trump looking orange as he listens to someone else speaking

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's hopes of securing an exemption from Donald Trump's incoming metals tariffs have been dealt a blow, with a senior presidential adviser accusing Australia of "killing the aluminium market".

title.children: Trump aide says Australia 'killing aluminium market' as US tariffs loom

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: Labor has been accused of reigniting its "Mediscare" campaign ahead of the federal election with a misleadingly edited attack ad in which opposition leader Peter Dutton declares "Medicare is dead".

title.children: 'Trying to create fear': Labor accused of 'disinformation' with misleading Dutton ad

image.altText: Luis Rubiales wearing a dark navy suit blazer and tie sitting in a dark office chair alongside a microphone

props.synopsis: In court, Luis Rubiales denied sexual assaulting Jenni Hermoso in the aftermath of Spain's victory at the FIFA World Cup in Australia.

title.children: Luis Rubiales says Spanish football player Jenni Hermoso consented to kiss

image.altText: The outside of an aircraft printed with the letters REX in blue and orange

props.synopsis: The federal government says it is prepared to acquire Regional Express if administrators are unable to find a buyer for the collapsed airline in an upcoming sales process.

title.children: Regional Express to be government-owned if airline fails to find buyer

image.altText: The logos of the four big banks in Australia

props.synopsis: APRA will also clarify that property developers do not need to have sold all units off the plan to get a loan.

title.children: Access to home loans to be easier for buyers with student debt

image.altText: Up close of man with bald head in suit stares ahead

props.synopsis: The US Justice Department has ordered federal prosecutors to drop corruption charges against New York City Mayor Eric Adams.

title.children: US federal prosecutors ordered to drop corruption charges against New York Mayor

image.altText: Compilation of images including a Iraqi sniper firing a weapon, a brain scan and a silhouette of a man

props.synopsis: Aussie veterans who helped train Iraqi snipers say they were exposed to hundreds of blasts a day, leaving them with long-term brain injuries.

title.children: Snipers suffer irreversible damage from 'invisible shock waves'

image.altText: A composite of a high-rise building, workers in hi-vis vests and a smiling couple.

props.synopsis: A former safety officer has blown the whistle on a culture of "fear and intimidation" within Australia's biggest apartment developer.

title.children: Meriton flouted government orders in push to build Gold Coast high-rise

image.altText: thumbnail

props.synopsis: As Japan grapples with new crises, nuclear power is once again being seen as the energy of the future.

title.children: 'They simply lack a plan B': Why Japan is betting big on nuclear power

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti mentioning Hitler and showing a swastika along a brick wall.

props.synopsis: Laws designed to curb racial hatred in NSW were the first pieces of legislation introduced to state parliament this year. Here's everything you need to know about them.

title.children: The new laws tackling antisemitism in NSW and why they have sparked criticism

image.altText: A shop-front window and double doors are covered in political advertising.

props.synopsis: A federal politician with two offices has used taxpayer funding to open a third. The catch? It's completely empty, and by the politician's own admission "clearly a billboard".

title.children: MP under fire for using $24k office budget on election advertising

image.altText: Fare evasion

props.synopsis: Authorities have dished out more than 3,000 penalties to commuters who did not pay their 50-cent fare since prices were slashed in August.

title.children: More than $1m in fines issued since 50c public transport fares started

image.altText: A close up photo of a man with an eyepatch covering one eye.

props.synopsis: The author of The Satanic Verses lost the vision in his right eye after he was stabbed in New York in 2022.

title.children: 'I thought he punched me': Salman Rushdie tells court of stabbing attack

image.altText: Passengers wait for delayed trains at Central Station in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A public transport expert says industrial action planned for Sydney's train network could shift public opinion about driverless trains, as some delays are paused on the city's rail network today.

title.children: Sydney train chaos could shift public opinion towards driverless trains

image.altText: A drying dam with only a small amount of water in a brown, rocky landscape

props.synopsis: Rainwater tanks, dams, and springs are running dry in Adelaide Hills and Fleurieu Peninsula while water carriers say they are struggling to meet the demand from both farmers and households.

title.children: Running out of water after record low rainfall in parts of SA

image.altText: Hayden Esparon with two mates getting ready for a fishing trip

props.synopsis: Running a local men's group brings me a lot of job satisfaction. It's also helped me through some difficult times.

title.children: I help men make friends. This is what I've learnt

image.altText: Two damaged green oranges with others scattered in the background and a man's boots

props.synopsis: Queensland citrus growers are counting the cost after several producers around Gayndah were hit by violent hailstorms twice in one season.

title.children: 'Kick in the guts' for citrus growers smashed by hail twice this season

image.altText: Two extremely cute kittens with dark blue-grey eyes.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's five microchip and registry companies has stopped operations, warning its website is "likely to go offline".

title.children: Microchip data for tens of thousands of Australian pets at risk

image.altText: A woman wearing shades and a blue jacket

props.synopsis: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf was taken off air part way through a fill-in presenting stint on ABC Radio Sydney after sharing a post from Human Rights Watch about the war in Gaza in December 2023.

title.children: Former ABC chair Ita Buttrose gives evidence in Antoinette Lattouf case

image.altText: Miles Amatosero of the Waratahs is tackled by Jock Campbell of the Reds

props.synopsis: The Super Rugby Pacific opener on Friday will mark the beginning of a Southern Hemisphere season in which the British and Irish Lions' tour of Australia looms large.

title.children: Super Rugby returns with a Lions tour looming large

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and red tie with lips pouted mid-sentence in front of a blurred painting of George Washington

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says no nation will be exempt although there’s a prospect of Australia winning a rare reprieve from tariffs on steel and aluminium imports to the United States. Today, economist Susan Stone on the latest front in the trade wars.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Will Albanese’s call with Trump save us from tariffs?

image.altText: Donald Trump purses his lips as he signs a piece of paper with a thick black marker

props.synopsis: The US president signed an executive order to dismantle so-called "DEI" initiatives in the government, claiming they resulted in "immense public waste and shameful discrimination".

title.children: What Trump means when he talks about DEI

image.altText: mango tray

props.synopsis: Scientists find the cause of mango twig tip dieback, eight years after the mysterious disease emerged in the Top End. Farmers say the discovery is a "first step" to treating the disease, which can drastically reduce mango yields.

title.children: Darwin researchers discover cause of mysterious mango disease

image.altText: Egg supermarket shelves empty

props.synopsis: Consumers are still facing egg shortages and price rises as the ramifications of Australia's largest bird flu outbreak continue to be felt.

title.children: Why is there still an egg shortage on some supermarket shelves?

image.altText: Sam Konstas prepares to play a ramp shot in a four-day cricket match

props.synopsis: Queensland's quicks are made to toil for a much-needed 188-run Sheffield Shield victory that appeared inevitable before some NSW resistance at the Gabba.

title.children: Konstas's trick shots not enough as NSW crumble, Tassie win thriller
